comments.html:
You said "You cannot use GETVPN to transport data sent between hosts with private IP addresses across public IP infrastructure (for example, the Internet)"

But if we have a DMVPN network we can then use GETVPN, right?
comments.name: Smail

comments.html: GETVPN as the encryption mechanism for a DMVPN-based network? Absolutely.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: You can use GETVPN across public infrastructure if you use LISP :-)
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
Not directly, as the traffic is no longer IP at that point... unless of course you put it into GRE envelope first. More details here:

http://blog.ipspace.net/2009/09/encrypting-p-to-p-router-traffic.html
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Can we use GET VPN technology to encrypt P to P and PE to P traffic in enterprise MPLS VPN deployment?
comments.name: Tega

comments.html: Don't think so (but then "never say never") - NAT in the path will most probably totally mess everything up.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Hi,
Is it possible to bring GET VPN between 2 endpoints, if the remote site (branch) has private ip address? Normally should not work, but worth to ask.

Regards,
comments.name: Anonymous
